title: Do the Andes expand into Brazil? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s see. These are the Andes  Image: Aspectos Físicos da América do Sul And on the right is Brazil. Andes in brown  Image: File:Mapa físico de Sudamérica.svg (https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Mapa_f%C3%ADsico_de_Sudam%C3%A9rica.svg) Thus, as we can see, Andes are not part of Brazil. Brazil’s territory have grown a lot since Treaty of Tordesillas - Wikipedia, which divided the newly discovered lands outside Europe between the Portuguese Empire and the Spanish Empire (Crown of Castile), along a meridian 370 leagues.  Brazilians continued expanding, but Andes proof to be a true barrier. Brazil already represents almost half of South America. If not by the Andes, would Brazilians have settled almost all over South America?
